@joe_jag @itakeunconf Great news! It was an excellent event in 2016, looking forward to hearing your talk this year.
@gunn_x I know! And in a building my Dad used to work in, back in the early 70's. I used to visit when I was a kid.
I always loved the "Vending Machine" code kata as a pair TDD exercise for hiring. But this...the possibilities... https://t.co/imyXwFcR1i
@brindy Damn :( Hope she feels better very soon. Remember to look after yourself too.
In Edinburgh to hear a talk by @Cmdr_Hadfield. Listening to an inspiring, thoughtful person seems an appropriate thâ€¦ https://t.co/pqGHfIEKpc
@joe_jag Ah, sounds excellent, but I'll be travelling back from FOSDEM at that time. Joined the meetup group though â˜‘ï¸
@nielskee I find that voice is the most important element - video and screenshare can lag as much as they like as long as voice stays OK.
@nielskee I used to prefer using a dial-in conference number for voice and separate video/s'share service. Clearer, but less convenient ofc.
@TartanLlama @ACCUConf I'll be there
@robsmallshire Aha, excellent, many thanks!
@robsmallshire That makes sense, the prices seems to jump from GBP160 to 2500 in a single step, and I guessed there was a reason for that.
@robsmallshire Very nice. So are the cheapy ones any use at all without major surgery? I was eyeing up some no-brand ones on ebay recently.
@therealandylj @CraigMcPheat Yep, most of them should have been one-time things. Having to repeat annually was irritating.
@CraigMcPheat In the end, half my email was overdue training reminders, and the other half was warnings my inbox was too full.
@CraigMcPheat A particular highlight of leaving TB was seeing how many of those I could leave overdue.
@alexboly As an agilist, I believe in responding to change over following a plan. The bagel was a change that needed me to respond :)
31/12: Definitely eating healthier in the new year. Resolution for sure. Definitely. 01/01: Breakfast bagel, oh yeaâ€¦ https://t.co/uC0vYBfAYk
@monkeybood We need to get you a Sarcastic Stick. Does @GiveMeTeaNow still have the Sarcastic Stick? Maybe she'll let you borrow it.
@monkeybood Both options need planning permission. Much easier to just not press the "I'd like a mouse, please" switch, like you did there.

@the13thcoder If I had the disk space, I'd wget --recursive and just grep the blasted thing.
I'm sure Qualcomm's acquisition of NXP is going to turn the NXP developer site into an even more labyrinthine mush than it already is.
Well, someone isn't getting into the Christmas spirit. #fungii https://t.co/0YF6FPZ4LN
@arne_mertz @robsmallshire @ACCUConf Excellent - looking forward to meeting you finally Arne :)
@robsmallshire This'll only be the third I've been to, but it's become a real highlight for me. I'd hate to miss it. It's unique. @ACCUConf
Oh, that'll be @ACCUConf 2017 registration open now. And that'll be me registered. https://t.co/hIUCnUPdXC
@CamMcVey That is elegantly brutal or brutally elegant. Can't figure out which. It's a thing of beauty though.
@nielskee Despite the Kindle and the bazillion PDFs I have, I still very much like the dead-tree format for some types of reading ðŸ“šðŸ›‹ðŸ¤“
@BearoftheC I bought things when I was a kid with old money: shilling, sixpence, threepenny, penny...I liked the threepenny - a dodecagon!
@edinbeth I like that too, the change in pace in reading feels relaxing. And you're kinda thinking about code in a background thread anyway.
@edinbeth Yup. I find that I need to do something so *completely* unlike my day-job code that it tricks my brain into being interested.
Came out to start Christmas shopping, going to #StarWarsRogueOne instead. Marks and Spencer gift vouchers will be fine again this year, eh?
@nielskee Congrats to you both!
@the13thcoder They're probably right. It does sound like the kind of thing I'd do.

@trionkidnapper Aha, it's out of not-very-stealthy stealth mode now! Thanks, I'll download the preview for a dabble ðŸ˜€

@BearoftheC Vibrio vulnificus! That was the flesh-eating thing I was trying to remember.

@gunn_x The Amiga was one of those machines I admired but never owned. Atari ST was another. I had a Dragon 32 ðŸ‰then a BBC Model B.
@gunn_x Oh, very cool, thanks :) I'd like to do some FPGA dabbling, it's on the do-list Getting to be a pretty long do-list though :p
@brindy I tried CLion again recently, and it drove me nuts. I'm tracking progress on it though...guess it's "one of these days" for me too.
@gunn_x Gonna have that down pretty soon. Just working on a strategy. Big tree only appears once a year, so it needs to be spectacular. ðŸ±ðŸŽ„ðŸ’¥ðŸ˜±
@robsmallshire Impressive! I couldn't hand-solder SMT components even if my life depended on it. Through-hole only for Captain Shaky here.

@cleverclauds Yeah, the "oh crap" is really an "oh yay!" :)
@cleverclauds I'm still doing that, for a language I've been working in since 1995.
@gunn_x Great to catch up, and quite a few familiar faces there! I missed the last C++ Edinburgh, but hopefully get to the next one.
@gunn_x Yup, all ticketed up :)

Oh, this is going to be fun! I'm looking forward to an evening of hands-on #swiftlang practice https://t.co/rBuaM7WGX4
@alexboly This is one of the things I find most valuable about TDD for C++ : "compilation time smells" as feedback on your design.
@gunn_x Yeah, I couldn't miss the chance to attend this session :) Hopefully at the next Edinburgh meet though.
Thanks to @WoodyZuill for a wonderful talk at @LeanAgileGLA tonight. I felt lucky to be at that. Great to get the story behind the practice.
@_ivanryan In a world of vast, almost completely pointless "Software Architecture Documents", it's a product just waiting to happen.
The Kinetis K64 ref. manual is 1789 pages. If someone invents a PDF reader with a "just print useful diagrams" feature, I will pay for it.
@meetingcpp Thanks! I can see a few there that I'll add to my must-watch list.
@meetingcpp The focus on embedded at CppCon was great this year, very encouraging. Hopefully more embedded devs will attend each year.
@meanestcreature Yeah. Brexit, now this. Welcome to the age of idiocy.
@alexboly I find this a huge problem, the way that excessive complexity has been normalised, and that people equate "simple" with "naive".
@chandlerc1024 Built and experimented with already. I really like the size diff feature especially. Thanks @JoshHaberman!
@CodeClanScot Excellent :) I have many very important decisions to make. This is just the thing. #amazing #cc7rocks
@brindy Prague, Switzerland, Bonnybridge : always listed as the top three must-visit destinations in any travel magazine.
@nielskee @meanestcreature Have a great first day!
@the13thcoder I use that occasionally for inspiration when I'm struggling to come up with a visual way of communicating an idea.
An old colleague contacted me, he'd remembered a site I'd shown him years ago but had lost the link. It's a wee gem: https://t.co/zfloUg658u
@abazlinton You're welcome! I had a great time doing it - it's always fun to visit @CodeClanScot
@cleverclauds You're very welcome, thanks for listening !
@royshantherobot @CodeClanScot I hadn't thought about bacon. Now I'm thinking about bacon. In fact, now all I'm thinking about is bacon.
@CodeClanScot Doing a talk at 12 on software development, careers, hiring, and the first few years on the job.
@CodeClanScot I'm very interruptible, so please come say "hi". I may be on my laptop, but that doesn't mean I'm doing anything worthwhile ðŸ˜
People @CodeClanScot: I'll be hanging around all day today, making a damn nuisance of myself, drinking your coffee & eating your biscuits.
@nielskee Totally legit secret agent though: it's all in the glasses. They're the same as those worn by Agent Burtâ€¦ https://t.co/AdmqAK4koD
@nielskee Well, just lambda a call to your MacBook then. Open a port. You're allowed to give 10.2% less of a shit now, because beer.
@nielskee $ npm install the-exact-thing-i-want-to-do-omg-it-has-a-hundred-thousand-dependencies-ohshit-ctrl-c-ctrl-c
@subsymbolics Have a great time! Say "hi" to everyone :)
@GarethStep @WoodyZuill I'm kinda hooked even with just a taster session! That's fantastic that you've made it a core team practice.
@CamMcVey Have fun :) You based closer to home this time?
@alebaffa I had to laugh a little at the poor Vim user getting an extra constraint in the "No Mouse" session :)
@BearoftheC It really is a rich history, influenced by so many cultures over the years. And I get the Roman connection far better now.
I made a long-overdue visit to the National Museum of Romanian History today. https://t.co/if63cYBdCA
Another amazing #gdcr. Thanks to @alinpandichi for superb facilitation, to generous hosts @mozaicworks & @mozaiclabs, and fellow crafters.
My first try at Mob Programming at #gdcr16 #gdcr : weird and fun in equal measure.
